image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old Canberra man pleads not guilty in the ACT Magistrates Court to allegedly performing a Nazi salute in front of the Gold Coast Hebrew Congregation in October last year.

title.children: Canberra man charged with performing Nazi salute outside synagogue

image.altText: A pharmacist in a chemist.

props.synopsis: Every morning when Chris Lawler opens the doors of his Canberran pharmacy, he knows some of the customers won’t be coming to purchase, but to steal. A new online portal offers hope things might get better.

title.children: Shoplifters raid this pharmacy ‘daily’, but police are too busy to act

image.altText: A brunette woman hugs her elderly mother.

props.synopsis: The ACT government will support Burrangiri Aged Care Respite Centre to stay open for another two years.

title.children: 'I was disgusted': Residents applaud delay of respite service closure

image.altText: Head on shot of the L2 Circular Quay light rail tram

props.synopsis: With light rails under construction around the nation, the case brought by Sydney businesses against Transport for NSW in the High Court today could set a precedent for compensation claims.

title.children: Should government pay for business woes over Sydney's light rail?

image.altText: A man in hand-cuffs is escorted by two police officers along a road.

props.synopsis: A case where a group of men allegedly impersonated police to break into a Mawson home appears before the ACT Magistrates Court, with police saying they believe the victim was mistakenly targeted.

title.children: Pair allegedly impersonated police in Canberra home invasion

image.altText: A woman wearing a rainbow striped sweater with dark hair in a bun sits on a couch doing a puzzle.

props.synopsis: A global shortage of ADHD medications is forcing doctors to get creative and pushing pharmacists into a "Hunger Games" style battle to secure supply.

title.children: Hunger Games battle for ADHD medication reaches peak in Canberra

image.altText: An Air Canada plane parked on the tarmac, taken on an unspecified date.

props.synopsis: The 2019 Vancouver to Sydney flight experienced significant turbulence at 36,000 feet. It landed in Honlulu, Hawaii, with 37 injuries recorded, nine of which were major.

title.children: Passengers who claimed injuries from turbulence lose High Court appeal

image.altText: The facade of the Goulburn Local Court, with its sign in front.

props.synopsis: A man charged over the fatal accidental shooting of a nine-year-old boy near Goulburn faces court for the first time.

title.children: Man faces court over accidental fatal shooting of 9yo near Goulburn

image.altText: A black and white image of a nursey full of babies, with a blue cross above one baby's head and the word "Elizabeth".

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Wray and Rohan Samara are two of the thousands of children evacuated from Vietnam at the fall of Saigon 50 years ago as part of Operation Babylift. They're embarking on a quest to find their biological families.

title.children: Liz and Rohan arrived in Australia in boxes. They're looking for their families

image.altText: Job advertisements

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate held steady in April as 89,000 people found employment — much stronger jobs growth than had been forecast.

title.children: Employment surges in April and unemployment rate holds steady

image.altText: Two men in a screenshot from CCTV hold jerry cans outside a building

props.synopsis: CCTV released by authorities shows three men with jerry cans throwing liquid into the Adass Israel Synagogue in Melbourne's south-east, before igniting a fire.

title.children: Car used in synagogue arson was previously used in nightclub attack

image.altText: A child is given oxygen during medical treatment.

props.synopsis: A boy is left badly burned after an unsafe child care incident. His parents rush him to hospital to save his finger. It should never have happened.

title.children: Childcare giant offered family money to stay quiet after boy badly burned

image.altText: Robert Walls holding the AFL premiership cup

props.synopsis: Australian Football Hall of Fame member and Carlton great Robert Walls has died aged 74.

title.children: AFL great Robert Walls chooses to end life under voluntary assisted dying laws

image.altText: Two people look at the statue of liberty

props.synopsis: Between early April and early May, Australia's Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade has changed the language of its travel warnings for the US three times in response to the Trump administration's tougher border stance.

title.children: Australia's travel advice for the US has toughened three times since April

props.synopsis: It's an exclusive tourist destination and one of the most pristine places on the planet. It's the last place you would expect to find birds with bellies so full of plastic that they crunch if you squeeze them.

title.children: On a pristine Australian island the birds are so full of plastic they crunch

image.altText: Donald Trump pumping one closed fist in the air at the top of the stairs to Air Force One.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's visit to the Middle East is certainly sending shockwaves across the region, as the president outlines his vision for relations between the United States and Arab states.

title.children: Cybertrucks and a snub: 5 key moments from Trump's day in the Middle East

image.altText: A man in a black hoodie and white sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Police release the photo of a Tongan man on the run after an early morning border force operation saw one official assaulted and another stabbed in the neck.

title.children: Police manhunt after immigration centre worker stabbed in neck

image.altText: A sketch shows Casandra Ventura wiping tears from her eye while in a witness dock in a courtroom.

props.synopsis: Sean "Diddy" Combs's former partner tells a New York court how he would allegedly threaten to release sex tapes to humiliate her and ruin her career.

title.children: Cassie accuses Diddy of rape and sex tape threats at trial

image.altText: A man with dark hair wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Former NSW Liberal MP Rory Amon, who has pleaded not guilty to sexually assaulting a 13-year-old boy, is released from custody after being charged with breaching his bail conditions.

title.children: Former NSW MP released from custody after being charged over bail breach

image.altText: A newborn baby peeps over a woman's shoulder.

props.synopsis: In the largest study of its kind, researchers tested the vitamin D status of more than 70,000 people as babies.

title.children: New study reveals vitamin D deficient babies at higher risk of mental disorders

image.altText: Two men wearing suits

props.synopsis: Russia has announced its delegation to discuss peace with Ukraine, with President Vladimir Putin's name notably absent.

title.children: Putin, Trump to skip Ukraine peace talks that Russian leader proposed

image.altText: A group of emergency services personnel stand facing the back of an ambulance with a large white sheet to the left

props.synopsis: The man, in his 40s, has been taken to hospital and is in a critical but stable condition.

title.children: Man bitten by shark off SA beach, emergency services say

image.altText: A man looks at the camera with a blank expression.

props.synopsis: An uncle of Caleb List, reported killed fighting in Ukraine, says his family tried to convince him not to re-enlist when he briefly returned from the war zone. Now they are holding onto hope he is alive.

title.children: Australian feared dead in Ukraine 'always wanted to be a soldier', family says

image.altText: Emergency vehicles and personnel near an overturned four-wheel drive and a destroyed caravan on the side of a road.

props.synopsis: A man has died and a woman has been left with life-threatening injuries after a vehicle towing a caravan rolled down an embankment on the Bruce Highway near the Sunshine Coast this morning.

title.children: Man dead, woman fighting for life after caravan smash on notorious highway

image.altText: Photo of artist Nara Walker standing close to a painting and looking at the camera. She has long brown hair and red lipstick

props.synopsis: Australian artist Nara Walker's name made international headlines after she was convicted for assault and imprisoned in a high-security Iceland jail. Now she's home, she explains how painting helped her endure the experience.

title.children: This Australian artist was imprisoned in Iceland. To endure it, she painted

image.altText: A close up shot of an African man with a moustache and greying short hair.

props.synopsis: A Legal Aid NT board member who resigned over the attorney-general making a "captain's pick" for the organisation's director position has spoken out, claiming the minister ignored formal recommendations over two rounds of recruitment.

title.children: Legal Aid NT board member speaks out after string of resignations

image.altText: A photo of a Chinese-Australian man Yang Hengjun, sitting on an outside table, wearing a navy polo shirt with a red collar.

props.synopsis: The Australian government continues to lobby for Dr Yang, who is imprisoned in China and has a cyst on one of his kidneys.

title.children: 'Tears blur my vision': Detained Yang thanks Australia as health declines

image.altText: A group of rangers and people in hi-vis stand among cars in a wooded area. Snow-topped mountains can be seen in the background

props.synopsis: A US rock climber survived 120-metre fall that killed his three companions and trekked more than 12 hours for help.

title.children: US climber treks 12 hours to payphone after deadly 120-metre fall

image.altText: Man with grey beard and hat (Craig Eury) holds up rock with fossil tracks in it.

props.synopsis: Fossil footprints found in Victoria by amateur palaeontologists have pushed back our understanding of when an early relative of most land-based creatures first evolved.

title.children: 'Surreal' fossil discovery pushes origin of reptiles back 40 million years

image.altText: Red wood ants dismembering a blue ground beetle

props.synopsis: Sydneysiders will have the chance to see 100 awe-inspiring shots in the annual tour of the Wildlife Photographer of the Year exhibition later this month at the Australian National Maritime Museum.

title.children: Bilby photo that took 'years' to snap among epic shots in Sydney exhibit

image.altText: A person runs through the bush.

props.synopsis: West Macs Monster event director Simon Duke says more than 500 competitors are lining up for five events across the weekend.

title.children: Outback ultra-marathon runners gear up for Red Centre test

image.altText: A balding man with grey hair, wearing a white shirt and blue blazer, with his chin in his hand

props.synopsis: Tóibín is one of the most revered figures in Irish literature, and he's visiting Australia to discuss his latest novel, Long Island.

title.children: Colm Tóibín has written a sequel to Brooklyn, but some readers aren't happy

image.altText: A member of the Hawthorn Hawks on the sideline, holding a sign which shows a bowl of noodles

props.synopsis: Football fans have been treated to unique and often peculiar signs shown from team benches, but to those who know, these signs are a crucial form of communication.

title.children: From noodles to 'WIN', the AFL has weird signs but the messages are crystal clear

image.altText: A person holds a phone showing an avatar on a map.

props.synopsis: New research shows nearly one in five young adults believe tracking a partner's location is to be expected in a relationship.

title.children: Tracking partner through apps 'problematic' as research finds link to coercive control

image.altText: a group of First Nations models are dressed in Indigenous designed clothes smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Backstage at Fashion Week, First Nations designers and models take a moment to reflect on the importance of representation.

title.children: ‘If you're Indigenous, you're beautiful’: Representation in fashion
